content: tower of babel hook stand i ve used a hook holder like this for years now it s a great way to keep your hooks handy and visible on a craft table or desk this pattern is also a good way to use up small amounts of cotton or cotton- blend yarn the version shown is suitable for smaller hooks for a larger piece suitable for your size p hooks try a thicker yarn materials 1 ball dalegarn svale or other worsted-weight yarn a fairly stiff yarn is best lily s sugar n cream works very well for a heavier version size f 3 5mm hook or size to obtain gauge gauge 5 stitches / 2 row per inch skills you will need chain stitch chain half-double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet decrease decrease yo insert hook and pull up loop yo and pull loop through two loops on hook two loops remain on hook insert hook into next stitch and pull up loop yo and pull loop through three loops on hook finished measurements approximate 7 tall 2 25 wide at base instructions chain 28 row 1 half_double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook half_double_crochet in each st across turn 27 sts made incl turning chain row 2-4 chain 2 half_double_crochet across turn 27 sts row 5 chain 2 decrease 1 half_double_crochet across turn 26 sts row 6 chain 2 half_double_crochet across turn row 7 chain 2 decrease half_double_crochet across turn 25 sts repeat row 6-7 5 times more 20 sts row 18 chain 2 half_double_crochet across turn row 19 chain 2 half_double_crochet across turn row 20 chain 2 half_double_crochet across turn row 21 chain 2 decrease 1 half_double_crochet across turn repeat row 18-21 11 times more 8 sts row 65-81 chain 2 half_double_crochet across turn tower of babel crochet hook caddy apr 5th 2008 v1 1 copyright © 2008 eleanor howe you should now have a long skinny triangle-ish piece of fabric tie off leaving a long tail for sewing starting at the widest end roll the fabric up tightly sew the remaining flap down to secure the bottom sew some spare yarn through it as shown
